text: Lotte Lenya (born Karoline Wilhelmine Charlotte Blamauer; 18 October 1898 – 27 November 1981) was an Austrian–American singer, and actress.Obituary Variety, December 2, 1981. She sang Kurt Weill's songs. He was her first husband. She married him twice. In English-language cinema, she was nominated for an Academy Award for playing an aristocrat in The Roman Spring of Mrs. Stone (1961). Her performance as the murderous and sadistic Rosa Klebb in the James Bond movie From Russia with Love (1963) is famous. == References == Category:1898 births Category:1981 deaths Category:Actors from Vienna Category:Actors who played Bond villains Category:American movie actors Category:American musical theatre actors Category:Actors from New York City Category:Austrian movie actors Category:Austrian singers Category:Austrian stage actors Category:Cancer deaths in New York City Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Singers from New York City
title: Lotte Lenya
